revised_title: Effects of Residual Elements on Engineering Steel Properties
tldr: This article investigates the effects of residual elements, such as phosphorus, chromium, molybdenum, nickel, and copper, on the properties of engineering steels. The authors analyze the impact of these elements on hardenability, tensile and impact properties, and mechanical properties of normalized and quenched steel. They conclude that while increasing residual element contents can improve hardenability and tensile properties, it is essential to control these elements to avoid violating property specifications.
